channel.title: Portforwarding error
channel.description:
I get how to do it and all but
Whenever i got to my CMD and type ipconfig it just says
"ipconfig" is not a recognized internal or external command blah blah ect. ect.
Anyone know how to fix

item.title: Portforwarding error
item.dc:creator: @mkti1 mkti1
item.description:
@mkti1 wrote:

i had this problem
1 - if you are windows 7 go to start search for ipconfig
2 - right click on it and click at “Open File Location” or something like that.
3- click up where it says computer - c - program files - **** - **** and CLICK NEAR THAT
4-copy it
5- press at start right click on computer and go to Properties then go to “Advanced system settings” then to Environment Variables" if you didnt find that go to the one under the Properties
6 : do new the name will be : “PATH” (without " and with capslock) and the value will be what you have copied …past it
7:press ok and press ok again
8: it is working

hopefully i helped.

IF THIS DIDNT HELP JUST RIGHTCLICK RUN AS ADMINSTATOR.

Read full topic
